Context / Background: Ancient Civilizati: The Indus Valley Civilization (IVC) flourished in modern-day Pakistan and northwestern India from 3300 to 1300 BCE.
The Vedic Period saw the rise of the Aryans, who brought the Vedic Sanskrit language and the concept of a unified Indian identity.
The Mauryan Empire, under Ashoka the Great, spread Buddhism and established a unified Indian state from 322 to 185 BCE.
The Gupta Empire, from 320 to 550 CE, is often referred to as the "Golden Age" of ancient India, marked by significant advancements in science, mathematics, and art.
The Harappan Civilization, discovered in the 1920s, is one of the earliest urban civilizations in the Indian subcontinent, with its capital at Mohenjo-Daro.
The ancient Indian city of Taxila, dating back to the 6th century BCE, was an important center of learning and trade, with connections to the Persian Empire and the Silk Road.
